We had a few questions about transportation after the first day of school for grades 7-12 and wanted to clarify before we welcome everyone back tomorrow. Attached you will find the bus routes for 2020-2021 school year. Disclaimer: our model of instruction for the 2020-2021 school year was based on phone survey about parents willing to transport their children to and from school to meet our capacity or 1/2 capacity guidelines on buses. Moving further we will only be making accommodations and changes for new students entering the school district. We cannot change bussing for weather related circumstances.
Students should not be riding any other bus than the one they are assigned to. Students should not ride a friend's bus, ride to a birthday party, ride to family members' house, etc.
If there are any bussing questions, they need to be brought to our Transportation Director by calling the Elementary Office at 507-754-5310.

At the regular monthly school board meeting held on August 18th, the GM school board unanimously approved the re-opening plan for the 2020-2021 school year.

Keep in mind this is the plan to reopen the school year. If the conditions or data shows a need to change Models of Instruction, the district may need to move to a more restrictive model or may move to a less restriction Model of Instruction as the year progresses. To see more specific details of the plan go to the district web page and under Quicklinks, the plan is posted.
www.gm.k12.mn.us

The district will start sharing more specific categorical plans. Later today there will be an e-news coming out that shares what the SAC (school age care) program has to offer. There is a deadline set to sign up so we can properly staff this program, so please make sure to adhere to that deadline. The district will be following the communication plan where we will be "chunking" information and sending it out categorically with one main topic instead of long, multi-categorical pieces of information to get the school year started.

Join us for this break in the Distance Learning journey !
